memberdef.name: actions
memberdef.initializer: = { action(sf::Keyboard::Left, [&]() {view1.move(-16, 0); }), action(sf::Keyboard::Right, [&]() {view1.move(16, 0); }), action(sf::Keyboard::Up, [&]() {view1.move(0, -32); }), action(sf::Keyboard::Down, [&]() {view1.move(0, 32); }), action(sf::Keyboard::Z, [&]() {view1.zoom(0.9f); }), action(sf::Keyboard::X, [&]() {view1.zoom(1.1f); }), action(sf::Mouse::Left, [&]() {if (is_object_under_mouse(rectangle_store, view1)) { create_object(get_position_from_rectangle_under_mouse()); } }), action(sf::Mouse::Left, [&]() {if (is_object_under_mouse(tile_store, view2)) { set_selected(); } }), action(sf::Keyboard::S, [&]() {view2.move(0,5); }), action(sf::Keyboard::W, [&]() {view2.move(0,-5); }), action(sf::Keyboard::C, [&]() {remove_object_under_mouse(); }), action(sf::Keyboard::BackSpace, [&]() {remove_last_object(); }) }

briefdescription.para: Check if a button is pressed at the given view.

detaileddescription.para: object : dialogbox& -> A dialog object.
view : view& -> A view.
bool : bool -> returns true if left mouse button is pressed on the given dialogbox.
Get_data(dialogbox, view1) return: {true}.

briefdescription.para: Get data from the database by giving a map.

detaileddescription.para: map vector : std::map<std::string, std::vector<std::string>>& -> a map vector which contains a string with all the database values.
vector : std::vector<object> -> returns a vector with all the objects from the database.
get_items_from_database(object_map) -> item_map is now filled with objects.

briefdescription.para: This function loads all background rectangles in the background vector.

detaileddescription.para: This method will fill the rectangle_store with rectangles.

briefdescription.para: This method loads all tiles which can be choosen at the right side of the level editor.

detaileddescription.para: This method will fill the tile_store with objects.

briefdescription.para: Set a object from the tile list as selected when there is clicked on it.

detaileddescription.para: This method is used in the code to be able to switch between objects.

briefdescription.para: Removes the last object from the temporary store.

detaileddescription.para: This function removes the last object from the temporary store.

briefdescription.para: This function removes the object under the mouse by pressing c.

detaileddescription.para: bool : bool -> returns a bool.
remove_object_under_mouse() -> true

briefdescription.para: Creates an object which is selected at the given position.

detaileddescription.para: position : sf::Vector2f -> position for object
Create_object({100,50}) Creates a selected object at position {100,50}.

briefdescription.para: Converts a mouse position to map coords on the given view.

detaileddescription.para: view : sf::View& -> view of the editor
vector : sf::Vector2f -> A vector converted to mapcoords.
convert_to_coords(view1); -> (256,596)

briefdescription.para: Get the position of the rectangle from rectangle store under the mouse.

detaileddescription.para: position : sf::Vector2f -> A vector2f position.
get_position_from_rectangle_under_mouse() -> (234,262)

briefdescription.para: Check if a picture object is under the mouse.

detaileddescription.para: vector : std::vector<picture*>& -> Give a picture vector with the function.
view : sf::View -> Give a view with the function.
picture_under_mouse : bool -> Returns true if the mouse is on a object. Example:
is_object_under_mouse(picture_vector, view1) -> true

briefdescription.para: Check if a figure object is under the mouse.

detaileddescription.para: vector : std::vector<picture*>& -> Give a figure vector with the function. view : sf::View -> Give a view with the function.
figure_under_mouse : bool -> Returns true if the mouse is on a object.
is_object_under_mouse(figure_vector, view2) -> true

briefdescription.para: Check if a button is pressed at the given view.

detaileddescription.para: object : 'picture& -> A picture object. view : view& -> A view. Return:
button_pressed : bool -> returns true if left mouse button is pressed on the given picture. Example:
Get_data(picture, view1) -> true

briefdescription.para: Looks if a menu button is pressed.

detaileddescription.para: back_to_menu_button_pressed : bool -> returns true if the back to menu button is pressed. sets other variables in the hpp on true or false if a button is pressed. Example:
menu_options() -> true

briefdescription.para: Constructor.

para.heading: This will create a leveleditor object. Parameters:

detaileddescription.para: levelsize : sf::Vector2f -> Give the levelsize with the function. tilesize : sf::Vector2f -> Give the tilesize with the function. window : sf::RenderWindow& -> Give a window with the function where the leveleditor needs to be drawn at. database : sql& -> Give the database to the function. Example:
leveleditor({1080,1080}, {32,32}, window, database);

briefdescription.para: The main loop for the editor to stay working.

detaileddescription.para: editor_loop();

briefdescription.para: Loop through the actions in the action class.
Draw the rectangle store on the screen.

detaileddescription.para: draw_rectangle_store() rectangle_store is now drawn on the screen.

briefdescription.para: Draw the background store.

detaileddescription.para: draw_background_store() background_store is now drawn on the screen.

briefdescription.para: Draw the tile store.

detaileddescription.para: draw_tile_store() Draw the objects from the tile_store.

briefdescription.para: Draw the temporary store.

detaileddescription.para: draw_temporary_store() Draw the objects from the temporary_store.
